results.title: Don Juan de Marco
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Francis Ford Coppola, Fred Fuchs, Patrick Palmer and Jeremy Leven
results.brief_description: Just ten days shy of his retirement, psychotherapist Jack Mickler (Marlon Brando) is brought in by the authorities to help ‘talk down’ a suicidal man (Johnny Depp), devastated by the loss of his lover. Clothed in a cape and mask the heart broken man believes he is the legendary seducer of women, Don Juan De Marco. The doctor takes him on as a patient and through their therapy sessions Don Juan recounts his many romantic adventures and conquests. At first sceptical of the mans sanity, Dr. Mickler is gradually seduced by Don Juan’s outlandish tales of love, leading him to question the fictional nature of his stories and the man’s real identity. It’s not long before Mickler is applying Don Juan’s instructional lessons on his wife (Faye Dunaway). Jeremy Leven’s unashamed paean to romance is given unexpected depth and poignancy from the exceptional cast, starting with the ever charismatic Johnny Depp and the inspired coupling of Marlon Brando and Faye Dunaway. Their intimate husband and wife banter is one of the films highlights. Cast also includes Geraldine Pailhas, Bob Dishy, Rachel Ticotin, Talisa Soto and Selena Perez.

results.title: Don Giovanni
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-Opera, Camera One, Michel Seydoux and Joseph Losey
results.brief_description: Dame Kiri Te Kanawa and Ruggerio Raimondi star in Mozart’s opera “Don Giovanni”, inspired by the exploits of the womaniser Don Juan and set in the palaces and countryside surrounding Venice.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gaumont-Opera, Camera One, Michel Seydoux and Joseph Losey
results.description: Dame Kiri Te Kanawa and Ruggerio Raimondi star in Mozart’s opera “Don Giovanni”, inspired by the exploits of the womaniser Don Juan and set in the palaces and countryside surrounding Venice.
description_for_label: Dame Kiri Te Kanawa and Ruggerio Raimondi star in Mozart’s opera “Don Giovanni”, inspired by the exploits of the womaniser Don Juan and set in the palaces and countryside surrounding Venice.

results.title: Don't look now
results.creator_credit: BL, Casey, Eldorado, Peter Katz and Nicolas Roeg
results.brief_description: When a little girl is accidentally drowned, her parents (Donald Sutherland and Julie Christie) go to Venice to forget. There they are told by a clairvoyant that their daughter is still very much alive. Adapted from a Daphne du Maurier short story, director Roeg (“Man who fell to Earth” and “Bad Timing”) has created a hypnotic horror film. The film is famous for its effective and shocking editing techniques, as well as its menacing use of the beautiful Venice locations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: BL, Casey, Eldorado, Peter Katz and Nicolas Roeg

results.title: Don't bother to knock
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Julian Blaustein and Roy Baker
results.brief_description: Don’t bother to knock features a rarely seen dark side to Marilyn Monroe’s usual performances. While babysitting in a hotel, she begins a flirtation with one of the guests (Richard Widmark). He is on the rebound after breaking up with his girlfriend (Anne Bancroft), and is willingly seduced by the babysitter. When the baby awakes and disturbs their lovemaking, Monroe becomes deranged and terrorizes both the man and child. The film gives a chilling glimpse into the mind of a homicidal personality.

results.title: Don's Party [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Art House Productions, Phillip Adams and Bruce Beresford
results.brief_description: Bruce Beresford’s classic Australian comedy exposes Australian social mores in the suburbs. Don and Kath have invited a group of friends to celebrate what they believe will be a Labor Party victory on Election night. The night begins happily enough until the guests receive the news that Labor is losing. Old enmities erupt as hostilities break out amongst the guests as the party disintegrates into an alcoholic disaster. Cast includes Ray Barrett, Graham Kennedy, John Hargreaves, Graeme Blundell, Jeanie Drynan and Clare Binney. DVD special two-disc collectors’ edition containing a ‘must see’ interview-style documentary (over two hours long), researched, edited and directed by Mark Hartley. Feature only also available on VHS [307072].

results.title: Dogtown and Z-boys
results.creator_credit: AOP, Vans Off The Wall, Agi Orsi and Stacy Peralta
results.brief_description: 1975 and in a slum area of Santa Monica, California, was located a rough neighbourhood know as Dogtown. In Dogtown, twelve teenage friends, many from broken homes, zealously surfed their dilapidated well-protected turf. Known as the Zephyr Boys - or Z-Boys for short - these teenage boys and one girl, applied their well-honed surfing skills to skateboarding and a fad that had all but died out was reborn. Fuelled by competitive drive and pushing each other to perform increasingly daring feats, the crew were inspired when a chronic drought left innumerable swimming pools empty. It was in these empty pools that the Z-Boys skated (illegally) and devised unheard of manoeuvres, revolutionising the sport. When “Skateboarder” magazine chronicled their audacious adventures, fame and notoriety beckoned. Whilst competing in the revived National Skateboarder Championships, the tricks performed wowed those present and the Z-Boys ruled. This documentary uses extensive stills and footage from the era (some of it quite astounding) and intersperses it with contemporary interviews with the Z-boys, who reminisce about their glory days and the forces that shaped their destiny. MTV style editing, a plenitude of vintage material and a rocking soundtrack (including Ted Nugent, Black Sabbath, Led Zepplin The Stooges and Jimi Hendrix) makes for great viewing.

results.title: Dogs in Space
results.creator_credit: Entertainment Media, Burrowes Film Group, Glenys Rowe and Richard Lowenstein
results.brief_description: Young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation.

constellations_other.name: Black Power through film and TV
constellations_other.description: The Black Power movement of the late 1960s and early 70s was “the most exciting and dynamic era in modern Indigenous history” according to Aboriginal activist Professor Gary Foley, who gained widespread attention for protests during the time and later leveraged film and TV to fight for Indigenous rights.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Entertainment Media, Burrowes Film Group, Glenys Rowe and Richard Lowenstein
results.description: A group of young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation living on sex, drugs, rock ‘n’ roll and television. Stars Michael Hutchence of INXS.

Stars Michael Hutchence of INXS.

results.title: Dog day afternoon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Martin Bregman, Martin Elfand and Sidney Lumet
results.brief_description: On August 22, 1972, a ninety-seven degree day in New York City, an extraordinary robbery occured minutes before closing in a branch of the Chase Manhattan Bank. As the blistering day progressed, details about two incompetent robbers and their victims emerged. In a Borough, where the absurd is commonplace, these details developed into one of the most bizarre news stories of the year. Starring Al Pacino, John Cazale, James Broderick, Charles Durning and Chris Sarandon.

results.title: Dodge City
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: Michael Curtiz (Mildred Pierce, Casablanca, Angels with dirty faces) directed this star vehicle for Errol Flynn with whom he collaborated the year before on “The Adventures of Robin Hood”. In “Dodge City” Flynn plays Wade Hatton, a successful and scrupulous man who, with a loyal crew in tow, herds buffalo across Texas to various destinations. On one such trip the crew are also protecting settler families headed for Dodge City. The frontier life is depicted as dangerous and corrupt, especially in towns thriving on alcohol, gambling and prostitution. As a town with no sheriff, Dodge City is such a town - violent, lawless and ruled by the local saloon owner who murders any individual that tries to collect on honest debts. As a principled and fearless man, Hatton is implored to be sheriff and clean up Dodge City. Flynn is well cast as Hatton, a charming and handsome cowboy. Oliva de Havilland (who starred as Maid Marion in The Adventures of Robin Hood) plays his love interest Abbie Irving, a schoolteacher and journalist. As a Western intended for the Saturday matinee “Dodge City” is replete with scenes of cattle stampedes, bar room brawls and runaway trains. “Dodge City” features some glorious exterior scenes and was filmed in Technicolour.
